column4: my samsung yp-p2 mp3 player isn't being recognised by gutsy via mtp-detect, but it is being shown by lsusb. How can I get it to work, I've added a line to libmtp.rules
you mean that you can transfer files through nautilus but would like to do it with mpt?
no, i'm just charging the thing up now, but mtp-detect doesn't detect it
actually, is it supposed to be supported by mtp? did you check that libmtp can recognise your device?
yes it is listed
oh, ok. What application did you try it with?
mtp-detect
like i said
do you have an mtp based player?
hmmmm. I don't know what else you can do. Although it is not recognized by mtp-detect, did you try it with Rhythmbox and what happens?
eh, no, I have an iPod.
I have enabled the mtp plugin in rhythmbox, but I can't see anything that relates to mtp, confused
yes, so neither Rhythmbox can see it.
doesn't look like it
should it give some extra menus or something?
it is supposed that if you enable the mtp plugin, your device should appear in Rhythmbox when you connect it
could it be a charging thing? I'm charging now
I think since your device is recognized as a usb device by ubuntu it can be charged. i think that it's independent of the mtp problem
it seems that udev has worked and mounted it tho, I do have /dev/libmtp-6-1 & /dev/libmtp-usbdev6.2
ok. do you think a mtp specific app that gnomad2 will help? I don't know what else you can do with mtp
i think i'll wait till it's charged and see what to do next
ok. sorry I couldn't really help you!
thanks anyway, i'll prolly see how it goes tomorrow
